testcase.name: Simple override uses last extraction for matching media types
Simple override uses last extraction for non-matching media types
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Simple override uses last extraction for non-matching media types Given I initialized a corpus at "corpus" ... passed in 0.004s When I ingest the text "alpha" with title "Alpha" and tags "a" into corpus "corpus" ... passed in 0.004s And I ingest the text "beta" with title "Beta" and tags "b" into corpus "corpus" ... passed in 0.006s And I build a "pipeline" extraction run in corpus "corpus" using the recipe: ... passed in 0.010s """ extractor_id: pipeline config: steps: - extractor_id: metadata-text config: {} - extractor_id: pass-through-text config: {} - extractor_id: select-override config: media_type_patterns: - "image/*" """ Then the extraction run includes extracted text for all items ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Simple override falls back to first extraction when enabled
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Simple override falls back to first extraction when enabled Given I initialized a corpus at "corpus" ... passed in 0.003s When I ingest the text "alpha" with title "Alpha" and tags "a" into corpus "corpus" ... passed in 0.004s And I ingest the text "beta" with title "Beta" and tags "b" into corpus "corpus" ... passed in 0.005s And I build a "pipeline" extraction run in corpus "corpus" using the recipe: ... passed in 0.008s """ extractor_id: pipeline config: steps: - extractor_id: metadata-text config: {} - extractor_id: pass-through-text config: {} - extractor_id: select-override config: media_type_patterns: - "image/*" fallback_to_first: true """ Then the extraction run includes extracted text for all items ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Simple override returns nothing when no prior extractions exist
Simple override returns None when no candidates have text
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Simple override returns None when no candidates have text Given I initialized a corpus at "corpus" ... passed in 0.003s When I ingest the text "alpha" with title "Alpha" and tags "a" into corpus "corpus" ... passed in 0.004s And I build a "pipeline" extraction run in corpus "corpus" using the recipe: ... passed in 0.004s """ extractor_id: pipeline config: steps: - extractor_id: select-override config: media_type_patterns: - "text/*" """ Then the extraction run does not include extracted text for the last ingested item ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Simple override handles malformed JSON in config gracefully
